text: This is a list of extinct animals of the Nordics (including Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, and Iceland). The list consists of common name, Latin name, known geographical range, and approximate extinction date, with the "†" symbol indicating the species is considered extinct worldwide. == Agmatans == *†Volbortella tenuis (Gotland, Sweden / Tanafjord in Finnmark, Norway – Cambrian) == Annelids == *†Lepidocoleus (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Plumulites (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Sabellidites cambriensis (Tanafjord in Finnmark, Norway – Cambrian) *†Spirorbis lewsisi (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Turrilepas (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) == Arthropods == === Crustaceans === *†Anabarochilina (Gössäter in Västergötland, Sweden – Cambrian) *†Coeloma (Skive, Denmark – Tertiary) *†Crustacea indet (Skive, Denmark – Cretaceous) *†Nephropidae indet (Langeland, Denmark – Tertiary) === Eurypterids === *†Dolichopterus gotlandicus (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Erretopterus carinatus (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Eurypterus serratus (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Holmipterus suecicus (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) *†Truncatiramus serricaudatus (Gotland, Sweden – Silurian) === Insects === *Blotchy mustard pyralid moth, Evergestis frumentalis (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Cattle warble fly, Hypoderma 2000 AD) *Eurasian white admiral, Limenitis camilla (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Everlasting tortrix moth, Eupoecilia cebrana (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Flax fruitborer, Cochylis epilinana (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Flowering rush weevil, Bagous nodulosus (Sweden – 2005 AD) *Gack owlet moth, Trichosea ludifica (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Green-white tuft moth, Nycteola svecica (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Gyllenhaal beetle, Gyrophaena nitidula (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Herbst beetle, Acritus minutus (Sweden / Norway – 2000 AD) *Koch leaf beetle, Psylliodes attenuata (Sweden – 2000 AD) *Large ranunculus, Polymixis flavicincta
